locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the biblical concept of 'holy fear' through Gideon and Peter, and the 'new thing' of God's grace through Isaiah and the baptism of Jesus.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher connects the Old Testament 'Angel of the Lord' with the presence of God and links Isaiah's apocalyptic vision to the person of Christ.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the nature of God's grace, with significant shifts toward promising and declaring in the final movements.
voorbeelden: God is for us in ways that we can scarcely imagine.
Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy.
He puts redemption into our blanket.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from a state of indifference or self-deceit to a state of 'holy dread' and subsequent comfort in the promise of grace.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicit in the closing prayers, though less emphasized in the body of the sermon text.

voorbeelden: Gideon is not in the least a mighty man of valor.
The fear of God is the beginning of wisdom.
The Babylonians were a great and powerful culture.
Count yourself blessed.
Listen to these words.
Grant that all who are baptized... may keep the covenant.
I think this is supposed to be funny.
I remember a fascinating story.
Alas, O Lord God!
I will be with you.
He promises you life (implied in 'I bring you good tidings').
God will interrupt the normal progression.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly rooted in the character of God, though often framed in the 3rd person.

voorbeelden: Your iniquity is pardoned.
Fear not.
Peace be to you.
declaratieven.autoriteit: High, specifically when quoting the 'Fear not' and the prophetic 'Comfort ye'.

indicatoren: Extensive retelling of the Gideon narrative.
Historical description of the Babylonian exile.
Analysis of the word 'fear' in English vs. Hebrew.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of biblical history rather than a participant in a current event.

missende_elementen: Direct present-tense commissioning of the specific congregation
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: A sense of 'aboutness' that delays the 'encounter' until the very end.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The toezegging (promise) is clear but often mediated through the biblical characters.
voorbeelden: The God who terrifies is also the one who loves us for all eternity.
He puts redemption into our blanket.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the hearer's situation (taxes, subway, sin).
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the 'holy dread' to the hearer's life.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Gideon, Peter, Isaiah, and the Babylonians.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that requires a 'bridge' to the present.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological definitions of grace and fear.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'irruption of grace' in the hearer's life now.

foutief_patroon.probleem: The sermon avoids moralistic 'must-dos' without grace.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Explanation of Fear) -> Declarative (Fear Not) -> Commissive (God loves you).
voorbeelden: You and I are deep in sin... yet there may suddenly come an irruption of grace.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The pattern is present but heavily weighted toward the initial Assertive phase.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: The awareness of sin comes only to those who are already standing on the firm ground of their salvation.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon excels at moving from the terror of the law to the comfort of the gospel, though it spends much time in the 'constative' mode of storytelling.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The fear of God is the beginning of wisdom because the awareness of sin comes only to those who are already standing on the firm ground of their salvation.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a solid intellectual foundation for the performative moment.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The angel displays amazing patience: he sits down under a tree and waits...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Too much time spent on 'talking about' the story rather than 'doing' the story.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final third when the preacher addresses the 'income tax' and 'subway' of the hearer's life.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The authority is derived from the text, but the preacher rarely uses the first-person declarative ('I announce to you').

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, God is the primary actor who 'interrupts' and 'invades'.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Implicitly, as the one bringing the 'good tidings'.
tekstueel_bewijs: The word of the Lord comes: Do not be afraid.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher trusts the 'irruption of grace' to happen to the hearer.
tekstueel_bewijs: There may suddenly come an irruption of grace.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is framed as a place where 'new things' are declared.
tekstueel_bewijs: God has come down in the person of his Son to be dunked in the muddy waters.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from past-tense narrative verbs to present-tense performative verbs.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The awareness of sin comes only to those who are already standing on the firm ground of their salvation.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Because you stand on the firm ground of salvation, I declare to you: look at your sin without fear.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general truth to a specific act of the preacher toward the hearer.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often 'about' God rather than 'from' God through the preacher.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use more 'I' (as God's ambassador) and 'You' (the hearer).
voorbeeldzinnen: In the name of Jesus, I tell you: He is putting redemption into your blanket right now.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: The use of 'you and I' is good, but could be more pointed.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, threshing your wheat in secret—God calls you a person of valor.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply theological and comforting sermon that successfully bridges the gap between biblical text and modern life, though it could benefit from more direct illocutionary force.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT, which would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or 'appeal', SAT identifies the 'Fear Not' as a reality-changing Declaration.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here is not in the 'vividness' of the Gideon story, but in the 'Commissives' where God binds Himself to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's climax is not the explanation of the word 'fear', but the performative 'Fear Not' which creates the peace it speaks of.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: This is the sacramental peak of the sermon.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: He puts redemption into our blanket.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Strong locutionary image that prepares for the perlocution of comfort.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'indicative' of the biblical narrative to carry the weight of the 'performative' address.
